name: Visual Studio Code
description:
See Visual Studio Code

A cross platform code editor with a strong community and extension selection.

As of .NET 6 it will be possible to build Maui applications. It is already possible to use it for many styles of projects. I would like to use this more than I currently do.

name: Xamarin Forms
description:
See Xamarin.Forms documentation

A cross platform mobile framework. Work in C# and deploy to Android IOS and UWP. Strongly encouraged to work in MVVM.

Being able to apply C# knowledge to mobile is a compelling aspect of this framework.

name: Elm
description:
See Elm

A language dedicated to building web applications using MVU. Wonderful error handling no runtime exceptions. Concerned about lack of drop in components.

name: Flutter
description:
See Flutter

A cross platform mobile and web framework using Dart. Friends have had great success with this framework on their projects. Wide range of components available and great community backing.

name: Azure
description:
See

Microsofts cloud offering. A large range of services available.

Developer projects are increasingly relying upon cloud services to speed up development time and address scaling. I want to gain experience with these services so I can consider them in solving problems.

name: CI/CD Pipeline For Personal Projects
description:
Explore using online or in house services in order to build test and deploy my personal projects.

Evaluate whether I can get value from doing this or whether it would just create more work

name: AngularJS
description:
See

A framework for building web applications in JavaScript. No longer being updated. Superseded by Angular 2+. Concepts like scopes tend to lead to unmaintainable messes. Slow initial load due to large initial download size. No good reason to adopt this for new projects and better to migrate old projects if the opportunity presents itself.
